Detailed Description

Defines a simple TLB (Translate Look-aside Buffer).

This object manages the Translate Look-aside Buffer of the simulated MIPS processor for the Nachos kernel. It is a cache of translations to provide the illusion of fast access to the address space

Member Function Documentation

void TLB::Add (  int  virtualPage,
int  physicalPage,
bool  readOnly
) 
 

Add an entry in the TLB.

Add a new entry in the TLB (LRU policy) Insert a new entry for the translation virtPage->physPage in the TLB, according to the LRU algorithm. ASSUMES that the entry was not already in the TLB !!!

Parameters:
virtualPage Translation for this virtual page number to insert in the TLB
physicalPage The physical page number corresponding to this new translation. WARNING: may correspond to out-of-memory pages
readOnly the new translation corresponds to a r/o page

Disable an entry in the TLB

vpn the virtual page number to be invalidated

bool TLB::Translate (  int  virtualPage,
int *  physicalPage,
bool *  readOnly
) 
 

Perform address translation.

Translate a virtual page number into a physical page number, using the TLB. If the entry corresponding to virtualPage is found, store the translated physical address in "physicalAddr" and the readOnly flag in *readOnly, and return true. If there is no corresponding entry, return false.

Parameters:
virtualPage the virtual page number to translate
physicalPage pointer to the resulting translated physical page number
readOnly pointer to indicate whether the translated page is r/w or ro
Returns:
true if the entry for "virtualPage" was found in the tlb. false otherwise.
